did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Audio recordings, correspondence, legal documents, manuscripts, memorabilia, photographs.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Books, articles, and movies Taormino wrote and directed, along with drafts, correspondence about their creation, production books for the movies and couple plays she directed, promotional material, and reviews and media coverage. There are audio and visual recordings of her lectures and media appearances. From her undergraduate years at Wesleyan, there are papers written for classes and her senior thesis, plus ephemera from sexuality activism. Also included is Taormino's collection of ephemera, posters, booklets, zines, magazines, and books written, produced, and created by other people on the topics of sex, sex positivity, gender LGBT/queer issues, BDSM, kink, leather, polyamory and non-monogamy, erotica and erotic photography, and pornography and feminist porn.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: A sex educator and feminist pornographer, Tristan has authored and edited numerous books and anthologies, which have sold over 500,000 copies and been translated into multiple languages. Early in her career, she worked as the Executive Assistant to Jay Hill, the Executive Director of the Gay Games (1994). Her first prominent job in erotic and feminist publishing came when she served first as columnist, then as editor of the feminist sex magazine On Our Backs (1998-2002). For nine and a half years (1999-2008), she wrote a bi-weekly column in The Village Voice, which appeared alongside Dan Savage's column "Savage Love" and won two Sex-Positive Journalism Awards. She wrote an advice column for Hustler's Taboo Magazine from 1999-2014. Her articles have appeared in Penthouse, Yale Journal of Law and Feminism, and numerous other publications. She runs her own adult film production company, Smart Ass Productions, started in 2005, and she was an exclusive director for Vivid Entertainment from 2006-2012, where she created and helmed the Vivid-Ed sex education line. She has directed and produced 25 adult films which have won numerous awards, including her multi-award winning debut film based on her book, The Ultimate Guide to Anal Sex for Women (1998). She has appeared on dozens of television shows alongside Ricki Lake, Melissa Harris-Perry, Howard Stern, and others; she worked as a script consultant for Spike Lee and appeared in John Cameron Mitchell's film Shortbus. She has lectured and taught workshops extensively throughout the United States, Canada, Germany, Sweden, Spain, and Australia at colleges, universities, conferences, and community events. She has been producer and host of the radio show and podcast Sex Out Loud since 2012.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes books, articles, and movies which Taormino wrote and directed, along with drafts, correspondence about their creation, production books for the movies and plays she directed, final commercial versions, and rough cut footage, as well as promotional material, reviews, and media coverage. There are audio and visual recordings of her lectures and appearances on television and radio. From her undergraduate years at Wesleyan University, there are papers written for classes and her senior thesis, plus ephemera from sexuality activism. Also included is Taormino's collection of ephemera, conference materials, posters, booklets, zines, magazines, and books written, produced, and created by other people on the topics of sex, sex positivity, gender LGBT/queer issues, BDSM, kink, leather, polyamory and non-monogamy, erotica and erotic photography, and pornography and feminist porn. There are also materials related to her work as an LGBT consultant for Spike Lee's film She Hate Me.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: For a period of fifty years after the assumed creation of any document, people using the collection may not publish the last name of any private individual mentioned therein, unless they receive permission from that individual. Researchers are asked to sign a form agreeing to abide by this rule for using the collection.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Tristan Taormino Papers, #7819. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Paper topics include Comedy and Christianity Center Around a Courtesan: a comparison of The Eunuch and Paphntius; Allegory in Early European Drama: a matter of life and death - A comparison of English morality plays and Spanish autos sacrametales with Everyman and La Vida es Sueňo as Representative work; Consumerism and Its Link to Happiness: a comparison between Paul's Case and Sister Carrie; Crossing the Color Line or Straddling It?: a comparison of Leaves from the Mental Portfolio of a Eurasian and The Autobiography of an Ex-Colored Man
Includes papers on Madonna and the Making of a Lesbian, Joe Turner's Come and Gone, and The Singular Life of Albert Nobbs

Includes 5th annual Lesbian and Gay Studies Conference packet, BDSM in NYC handouts, first edition of the Purple Circuit Newsletter, newspaper and magazine clippings, Buttons and Bumper Stickers order form, 9th annual Los Angeles International Gay and Lesbian Film and Video Festival calendar, Astraea National Lesbian Action Foundation Bulletin
Includes notes on thesis and invitation to Class of 1993 commencement ceremony

Paper topics include Queer Nerd Fantasies: Theory, Politics, and Making a Difference in the Academy; A Parody of the Straight Mind: The Subversion of Hegemonic Discourse of Gender and Sexuality in Kiss of the Spiderwoman; The Possession and Obsession of the Phallic Source: Gender, Hetero/Sexuality, and Alternative Sources of Pleasure in D.H. Lawrence's Women in Love; Lesbians and Political Identity: Issues of Separatism in the Gay and Lesbian Community; Tie Me Up and Set My Body Free or Macho Sluts Coming to Power: Audre Lorde's "Uses of the Erotic" and Lesbian Sadomasochism; Women's Studies final exam; Renegotiating Parenthood: Inventing the Male Mother in the Baby M Case
Posters put up during orientation, not by the official LGBT group, created controversy because of sexually explicit language

processinfo.p: Dark Odyssey is an event that happens twice a year and brings tantra & spiritual sex folk, kink, swingers, and polyamory people together for educational events, social time, and programs. Tristan Taormino is a co-founder and co-producer. The event still goes on., although she stopped organizing it after 2010. Files include the programs, etiquette list, correspondence and planning documents. Arranged in chronological order.
